metadata.titel_preek: Being Glad About Being A Christian

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from religious gloom and historical anxiety to a state of perpetual celebration (banquet) through the presence of Jesus as the Bridegroom.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ had made their lives a banquet
The Lord has held our hand and guided our footsteps
God has led his dear children along
God is at work even now
gladness and joy are the mood of those around him
life had turned into one perpetual banquet
the bright visions the Lord has given us
The Lord is blessing me right now
we have been restored to full citizenship

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Holy Spirit (implied through song/shout)
tekstueel_bewijs: in Jesus the charge has been dropped
beneath the shadow of his wings my defenseless soul can hide

tegenstander.identificatie: Legalism, Sin (The 'Old Charge'), and Historical Despair
tekstueel_bewijs: people have associated a frown with religion
every enemy of freedom... has failed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad moods, but a legal 'charge' and the 'dark clouds' of history that only God can beat back.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Christian's response of praise and perseverance in history.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's action (praising, marching) is a direct result of the 'charge being dropped' in the primary program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord has held our hand.
Jesus Christ had made their lives a banquet.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We march on into our tomorrows.
We have only to keep faith.

voorbeelden: Christians ought not to live there [swamps of sadness].
don't you rest until you find it.
The gladness of the Christian is... situated around Jesus Christ.
God is able to get us all of the way.
the world can't do me no harm.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's power (Pouvoir) to change the believer's state, rather than the believer's duty (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Pharisaic gloom) through ~S1 (False gladness) to S1 (Christ-centered joy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the presence of the Bridegroom, which makes S2 impossible.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'old charge' and 'dark clouds' are treated as real threats.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. Joy is not a work to be performed but a state produced by God's prior action (dropping the charge).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christians ought not to live there.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In Jesus the charge has been dropped, our record has been cleared.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (disciples) are used as witnesses to an event, not as moral models to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The disciples are 'receivers' of the banquet Jesus provides.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic joy; God initiates the celebration.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Strong integration of the 'already' (charge dropped) and the 'not yet' (reaching the mountain).
spanning_punten: The transition from God's action to the national/political destiny of the Republic.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Old differences between us and God have been straightened out... the charge has been dropped.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the atmosphere of the 'banquet' that grants the believer the power to be glad.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'charge' and 'folly and wickedness'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject. The 'Object' (Gladness) is correctly rooted in the 'Sender's' (God's) grace.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon avoids the trap of 'Devoir' (You must be happy).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The 'old charge' is mentioned but could be more vividly defined as the 'Opponent' to heighten the relief of grace.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Elaborate on the 'accuser' or the weight of the 'charge' before the drop.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To increase the 'Soteriological Depth' of the joy.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of grace-oriented preaching that uses the actantial role of Jesus as 'Bridegroom' to redefine the hearer's existence from 'fasting' to 'feasting'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the use of the Scarlett O'Hara metaphor, semiotics reveals that O'Hara is a 'False Subject' failing to achieve the 'Object' of peace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Markan context; Greimas shows how the 'Bridegroom' actant functions as the source of 'Pouvoir-faire' (ability to be glad).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'gladness' is not a psychological choice but a narrative necessity caused by the presence of the Subject (Jesus).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'we' frequently, but usually as the Receiver of God's action.
